div.p: There are font-ish things that may be bad1, and size competitions. But sometimes they're useful for things like code2.
Then there are so-called generic requivalents, but they don't make much difference.
Then the are actual ones for things like abbreviations (Dr. Smith), acronyms (NASA), addresses (1 Main St.), code (x := y++), keyboardables (ENTER), variables (argc), etc.
